ILLINOIS FINANCE AUTHORITY OVERVIEW:   
Looking for an opportunity to use your skills and education to better your community and the State of Illinois? Are you interested in public service and professional growth? The Illinois Finance Authority (IFA) could be for you! As a unique organization that sits at the intersection of finance and public policy, we are searching for candidates that will help us improve the quality of life in our communities where we work and live. 
  
IFA provides access to low-cost financing to private and public organizations as well as individuals that are aligned with our statutory mission of promoting a vigorous and growing economy, creating and retaining jobs, and lowering the cost of government for the diverse community of Illinois residents. To date, IFA has financed hundreds of projects across our state, including hospitals and healthcare systems, universities, colleges and schools, drinking water and sewer systems, cultural institutions, senior living and other housing projects, public-private partnerships, businesses, including factories and distribution facilities and individual farmers. 
  
IFA is a body politic and corporate created by State law through the consolidation and elimination of seven predecessor entities in 2004. IFA does not receive appropriated funding from the State of Illinois and operates at no cost to State taxpayers. IFA is governed by a fifteen-member, volunteer Board appointed by the Governor and confirmed by the Illinois Senate.  IFA staff offers a breadth and depth of professional, legal and financial expertise necessary to close complex financial transactions. IFA board and staff meet monthly to consider pending projects consistent with our statutory mission. Materials are available on the IFA website: www.il-fa.com 
  
IFA offers a competitive total compensation package with generous benefits, including but not limited to, 457 and 401(a) defined contribution plans, comprehensive health insurance, life and disability insurance, and paid time off. Employees working at the IFA are at-will employees and not employees of the State of Illinois. IFA is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, among other things, or as a qualified individual with a disability. 
  
  
  
  
SUMMARY:   
This position is an entry level role intended to provide broad exposure across all aspects of IFA business lines. This individual is responsible for supporting the various sector leads in processing transactions from application to closing in order to generate revenue for the IFA. 
  
  
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
  
1.   Review qualified borrowers’ application forms and audited financial statements. 
2.   Review qualified borrowers’ financial statements and analyze applicable ratios using Microsoft Excel. 
3.   Assist sector leads in drafting credit memoranda and/or resolutions for presentation to IFA Committees and Board of Directors. 
4.   Monitors and manages IFA tasks and responsibilities at the direction of sector leads, including maintaining close correspondence with transaction parties to ensure financing documents are in proper form and are received on a timely basis pursuant to working group and established deadlines. 
5.   Researches and tracks rated borrower debt via the Electronic Municipal Market Access (EMMA) System. 
6.   Serves as a point of contact with transaction parties to financings, including borrowers, legal counsel, and banks. 
7.   Responds to requests from internal and external auditors as needed. 
8.   Provides necessary administrative support on all tasks related to transactions, including maintaining accurate project files and assisting in meeting preparation. 
9.   Performs other related duties as assigned by management. 
  
  
QUALIFICATIONS:  
  
1.   Bachelor’s degree in public policy, finance, banking and/or liberal arts. 
2.   Strong analytical skills, understanding of basic financial concepts 
3.   Interest or experience working in Illinois State or local government including the legislative process and/or public service desired but not required. 
4.   Acute attention to detail 
5.   Able to learn quickly and integrate learning into a variety of situations. 
6.   Must be able to communicate thoughts clearly, both orally and written. Must be able to communicate to all levels within an organization, vendors and the public. 
7.   Demonstrated ability to adjust quickly to different work situations; remain composed under pressure. 
8.   Strong relationship-building skills, good team player.
